DataElement.preferredName: Study Time Point Identifier 64 Character Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An identifier specifying the one or more studies that are grouped together as a clinical time point or submission in a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify a specific point in the time continuum about research conducted with human subjects in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects in a clinical environment.  [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A type of research study that tests how well new medical treatments or other interventions work in people.  Such studies test new methods of screening, prevention, diagnosis, or treatment of a disease.  The study may be carried out in a clinic or other medical facility.  Also called a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.:One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.
One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI. jc  1/2/11 Released as part of model cleanup.  6/21/07-revised property to use new timepoint CUI.  6/6/07 DEC created to support DICOM CDE task utilizing IE DICOM Attribute terms.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: LO: A 64-character string with leading or trailing spaces being non-significant; NO CONTROL characters. [Standard-based]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: An expression consisting of a linear sequence of symbols (characters or words or phrases).

ValueDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/30/13 added DICOM RT CSI. jc 3/16/09 - set min length from 0 to 1. 2007 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6 2006 DICOM Standard - Sections 5 & 6

DataElement.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI. jc  4/26/11 removed link to 6678-T1, T2, T3 to ACRIN Study-Form -> 6678-T1, T2, T3.  1/2/11 Released as part of model cleanup.  9/21/07  Added ACRIN alt name & form refs.   8/13/07-added ref t oACRIN-PET.  6/25/07 -CDE versioned to support DICOM CDE IE - DICOM Attribute-DICOM VR Rep term format.;  CDE supports DICOM Standard PS 3 - 2004.
